text_result.title: Infant of <span class="mak_1">diabeti</span>c mother - MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> Return to top An infant of a diabetic mother is a baby born to a mother who has diabetes The phrase specifically refers to a baby who is born to a mother who had persistently high blood sugar glucose levels during pregnancy Causes     			 			 <strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> women often have specific effects on their infants Infants born to mothers who have diabetes are generally larger than other babies They may have large organs particularly the liver adrenal glands and heart These infants may have a hypoglycemic<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> the infant Overall there is an increased chance that mothers with poorly controlled diabetes will have a miscarriage or stillborn child If the mother was diagnosed with diabetes before the pregnancy her infant also has an increased risk of having<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>
